intro: Geigeria macdougalii, commonly known as the African bluebell, is a herbaceous perennial native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in late winter to early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Geigeria macdougalii is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
